cscie97.asn4.ecommerce.collection

Class Collectible

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie97.asn4.ecommerce.collection.Collectible
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Collection, ContentProxy

    public abstract class Collectible
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract parent class for Collection and ContentProxy objects. Collectibles can contain child Collectibles, which makes them a tree structure. Because arbitrary numbers of child Collectibles can be added, the class supports a CollectionIterator for iterating over all child elements. The object types that may be created that are children of the Collectible class are:
    • StaticCollection
    • DynamicCollection
    • ContentProxy
    All of these types will inherit their shared attributes (id, name, description) from this class.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    David Killeffer <rayden7@gmail.com>
    See Also:
    Collection, Collectible, DynamicCollection, StaticCollection, ContentProxy

    • Constructor Detail

      • Collectible

        public Collectible()

    • Method Detail

      • getIterator

        public CollectionIterator getIterator()
        Returns the iterator for the current collection. The iterator also follows the Singleton pattern; once the iterator has been declared and initialized, the already-declared one will be returned. If the iterator has not been defined when getIterator() is called, a new CollectionIterator will be created and initialized.
        Returns:
        the iterator for the Collectible

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<Collectible> getChildren()
        Returns the current set of children Collectible objects that are contained by this Collectible. Note that while the children of the current Collectibles are all themselves Collectible objects, their actual types may be one of:
        • ContentProxy (used to wrap the Content objects that get returned by the IProductAPI
        • StaticCollection
        • DynamicCollection
        Note that if the current Collectible is actually a DynamicCollection, this method will still return the found ContentProxy objects that are found by executing the search (no need to separately execute the search).
        Returns:
        the list of child ContentProxy objects contained in the current Collectible

      • add

        public void add(Collectible collectible)
        Adds a child Collectible to the current Collectible. Since the children of the current Collectible will be modified as a result, a side effect of adding a new Collectible is to null out the current iterator (so that the next time a client wishes to iterate over the Collectible the new item will be included).
        Parameters:
        collectible - the new Collectible to be added to the Collectible

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Gets the unique identifier for the current collectible.
        Returns:
        the unique string ID for the current collectible
